intro: Hieracium rackii, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from yellow to deep purple. Hieracium rackii is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils, making it a resilient species in alpine environments.
